import React, { useState, useEffect } from 'react' import Tab from 'react-bootstrap/Tab'; import Tabs from 'react-bootstrap/Tabs'; import Form from 'react-bootstrap/Form'; import FiltersLibrary from '../FiltersLibrary' // pobieranie slownika gatunkow function Filters({ albums, setRealFromChild }) { const [filters, setFilters] = useState({ artist: '', title: '', genres: '', band_name: '', label_origin: '' }) useEffect(() => { var f = new FiltersLibrary(albums, filters) var match = f.manage() function removeDuplicates(arr) { return arr.filter((item, index) => arr.indexOf(item) === index); } setRealFromChild(removeDuplicates(match)) }, [filters]) const handleInput = (e) => { const keyName = e.target.name const keyVal = e.target.value setFilters(prev => ({...prev, [keyName]: keyVal})) } return (
{/* Search by phrase - artist name */} Artist name It is common on Bandcamp for label to put their name as artist name. In this case try to search artist name also in album's title. {/* Search by phrase - album title */} Album title It is common for label to put artist's name in album's title field. {/* Search by phrase - genres */} Genres Simplified search by key value. {/* Search by phrase - label name */} Label name If an artist doesn't have label, Bandcamp assigns artist name to that field. {/* Search by phrase - label name */} Label origin Label or artist origin.

Work in progress.

 ) } export default Filters
